title: A weekend in . . . Stockholm, Sweden
text:
Ruth Elkins   24 2015 
Gingerly, I lower myself on to the ice. The jetty sinks into a sliver of black, icy water, revealing that 1) in Stockholm you are never far from water, and 2) I am about to skate on the Baltic Sea and it isn’t entirely frozen. 
Sigge, our ice guide, laughs. Natural ice-skating requires only 5-6cm of ice if it’s freshwater, 7-8cm if it’s saltwater. “We’re not driving cars on it,” he says. How thick would the ice have to be for cars, I ask. “A bit thicker,” he says with a shrug. Sigge, who is lithe and tanned and belies Subscribe now
